intro: Tordylium lanatum, commonly known as the woolly tordylium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and swamps. Its leaves are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Tordylium lanatum is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
